data.name: CONTACT_ADMIN
data.value: contact your systems administrator.

data.name: ERROR_CONFIG_SCREEN_DATA_LOAD
data.value: There is an issue retrieving data from an existing configuration file. This error could occur if the file was copied form a different computer. Please check the values, test and resave the data.

data.name: ERROR_CONFIG_SCREEN_DATA_LOAD_TITLE
data.value: Unable to completely load from the configuration file

data.name: ERROR_DETAILS
data.value: Below are the technical details for the issue:

data.name: ERROR_MAIN_CONFIG_DATA_LOAD
data.value: Please close the program and try again. If the issue persists then contact a systems administrator.

data.name: ERROR_MAIN_CONFIG_DATA_LOAD_TITLE
data.value: Unable to completely load from the configuration file

data.name: ERROR_ORA_03113
data.value: Network communications was interrupted or lost to the TransInfo Database. Please ensure that you have network access and then try again. If the issue persists then contact a system administrator.

data.name: ERROR_ORA_04068
data.value: A TransInfo System Administrator is most likely preforming system maintenance and the broker cannot continue. Please wait a few minutes and try again. If the issue persists then contact a system administrator.

data.name: ERROR_ORA_CONFIG
data.value: The Database Configuration File could not be found. Please

data.name: ERROR_ORA_CONFIG_EX
data.value: The ora_connect.xml file needs to be created by the broker Systems Administrator.

data.name: ERROR_SFA_LOCATION
data.value: highway <H> at milepoint <M>

data.name: ERROR_SFA_LOG_UNHANDLED
data.value: The installation on <LOC> contains an error preventing synchronization. Please review the record for possible issues or contact the Sign Asset Database Administrator.

data.name: ERROR_SFA_NOT_FOUND
data.value: SFA Access Databases Not Found or producing errors. Please verify you can open the sign_client.mdb with out errors and then retry the sign_broker. If this error continues then

data.name: ERROR_SFA_NOT_FOUND_EX
data.value: The SFA MDB paths in the configuration file need to be checked or the sign_client.mdb is producing errors when opening.

data.name: ERROR_SFA_NOT_INI
data.value: SFA Access Database Internal Error

data.name: ERROR_SFA_NOT_INI_EX
data.value: Please ensure the signs field app can be run, then try the broker again.

data.name: ERROR_SFA_VERSION_NOT_FOUND
data.value: An acceptable Broker Version Number could not be found in the SFA database. •Please Close the Broker. •Then ensure that you have a network connection to the ODOT network. •Once you have confirmed the network connection, please restart the Broker from the shortcut provided by your systems administrator. If the issue persists, then

data.name: ERROR_SFA_VERSION_NOT_FOUND_EX
data.value: Version Control Mismatch.

data.name: ERROR_TI_API
data.value: An Issue occured with the Oracle Database Please

data.name: ERROR_TI_API_EX
data.value: xodot_signs_api.get_version is generating an error. Please have a TransInfo administrator verify the state of the xodot_signs_api package.

data.name: ERROR_TI_TO_SFA_WITH_EDIT_ITEM_IN_SFA
data.value: The Item that is attempting to sync from TI to SFA has items that are not synced in the Edit Table. Please Fix any Errors relating to this Item in the SFA to TI sync and try again.

data.name: ERROR_UNEXPECTED
data.value: Unexpected Issue, please have your System Administrator check the TRANSINFO Database Error log.

data.name: INFO_SYNC_COMPLETED
data.value: Sync Process Complete

data.name: TASK_LOV
data.value: TI to SFA Lookup Lists

data.name: TASK_POPULATING_TASKS
data.value: Populating the Task List

data.name: TASK_SFA_ITEMS
data.value: SFA Changes to Sync to TI

data.name: TASK_TI_ITEMS
data.value: TI to SFA Install Items to Sync

data.name: TI_BAD_USER
data.value: The user name used to log into TransInfo does not have rights to access the Signs Data. Please

data.name: TI_CONNECTING
data.value: Attempting to connect to TransInfo. Please Wait.

data.name: TI_CONNECT_ERROR
data.value: Unable to connect to TransInfo, Please check your network connection and try again. If the issue continues then

data.name: UNHANDLED
data.value: An unhandled fatal issue occurred, please
